intro: Justicia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's rosemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is drought-tolerant. Its leaves are oppositely arranged and have a rough, hairy texture, while its stems are often hairy as well. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds.
